meanings.definition: Exposed to too much light or radiation.
meanings.sent1: The photograph was overexposed, making it too bright to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The camera settings were wrong, causing the image to be overexposed.
meanings.sent3: The sun overexposed the film, turning the picture into a white blur.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt overexposed under the scorching sun, like it was being burned.
meanings.sent5: The overexposed photo looked like a glowing beacon in the dark room.

meanings.definition: Having been subjected to excessive publicity or attention.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity felt overexposed with all the paparazzi following her every move.
meanings.sent2: The politician became overexposed after appearing on multiple talk shows.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt overexposed when everyone kept staring at its new outfit.
meanings.sent4: Her popularity had overexposed her to the point where she couldn't go anywhere without being recognized.
meanings.sent5: The overexposed social media influencer struggled to maintain a sense of privacy.
